body.name: Cuphead - Nintendo Switch
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Monday, February 19 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
Or fastest delivery Thursday, February 15. Order within 12 hrs 56 mins
features: Experience the classic run and gun action with a pal in 2-player local co-op
Includes the “Delicious Last Course” expansion filled with new bosses and brand-new character Ms. Chalice
Includes exclusive “Cuphead Funnies” comic collector cards & vintage-inspired “Cuphead Club Membership”, and a hand-drawn reversible coversheet
body.description: Come one, come all, to witness an interactive entertainment spectacle for the ages. Presenting…the all-cartoon Wondergame, Cuphead!! In this classic run and gun action game, play as brothers Cuphead or Mugman (in single player or local co-op) as you traverse strange worlds and take on massive, screen-filling bosses to earn your souls back from The Devil himself! It’s no exaggeration to say there really isn’t any other experience like this worldwide phenomenon from developer Studio MDHR. Inspired by cartoons of the 1930s, Cuphead’s visuals and audio are meticulously created with the same techniques of the era: traditional hand drawn cel animation, watercolor backgrounds, and original jazz recordings. Cuphead truly is a playable cartoon that feels plucked from the golden era of animation. But that’s not all! This rollicking retail edition includes the incredibly popular DLC expansion “The Delicious Last Course”, offering players a bevy of additional bosses, wondrous weapons & charms, and all-new playable character Ms. Chalice. Add in a set of delightful pack-ins lovingly crafted by the artists at Studio MDHR, and you get quite simply the most complete Cuphead experience ever, perfect for long-time fans and newcomers alike!

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: About Us Founded in 2005, iam8bit is a creative production company that refuses to be pigeonholed, having crafted unique and memorable experiences for a broad spectrum of brands like HBO, Nintendo, PlayStation, Disney, MTV, Activision, Universal, Capcom, Interscope, Warner Bros., Machinima and countless others. These attentively cultivated experiences come in many forms — from events to mailers to commercials and films. In addition, iam8bit is currently developing several original IPs for feature, TV and digital distribution — as well as curating regular exhibitions at their Los Angeles-based gallery. The company is co-owned by Jon M. Gibson and Amanda White.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 10, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Brutally Hard and Unbelievably Fun
reviews.reviewText: The rumors are 100% true, Cuphead is hard as hell. What I didn’t expect was that a vast majority of the game was what one would consider to be boss battles. You can play on Simple or Regular mode, and I’ve been playing on Simple thus far. I can tell you, it ain’t simple. I’m not a fan of games that are purposely difficult to match the lack of content. Mega Man 11 springs to mind. MM 11 was extremely hard in later levels, but it also wasn’t enjoyable for me. Once I finished a level, I never wanted to play it again. The game felt unfair rather than challenging. Cuphead feels hard but fair and after I fail, I immediately want to try again and again and again.There are times that I can play for an hour or two and not beat a single level. However, I do feel like I’m getting closer. It’s about pattern recognition and learning how enemies behave. It reminds me actually of Punch Out in the memorization of patterns and although it maybe not require the same perfection of timing that Punch Out asks for, it’s harder in that it’s less predictable than Punch Out. In Cuphead, you can also have two, three or four attacks coming at the same time from different directions, so you need to do some serious mental multitasking. There are even the occasional bullet hell sections. If you’re looking to improve your eye hand coordination, it would be hard to find a better training ground than Cuphead.The gameplay is excellent but what really sets Cuphead apart is the unforgettable art style. I do wonder if they didn’t draw a tiny bit of inspiration from the 2012 Skullgirls which had a little of the classic Disney vibe with a hefty dose of horror to it, but Cuphead takes it all the way. There is constant artifacting on the screen as if it were from an aged film reel. The music all sounds realistically old and even a bit muffled. Even the announcer voice sounds like it was recorded on a mic from the 40s. The backgrounds and bosses all look like they were animated in the 1930’s or 40’s. This is truly one of the coolest looking games I have ever seen.As hard as the game is, it is possible to make it much easier. You can purchase alternate weapons including one that shoots bullets that chase the enemy to allow you to focus on dodging. I also, for the longest time, didn’t realize I had an EX meter to deliver a powerful strike. That was my own dumb fault. You really need to get the buttons to become second nature to beat some of the bosses. Thus far I’ve managed to beat every boss on Simple and a handful on Regular in order to get their souls. To get to the final boss you need to beat every boss on Regular and that is going to be a helluva task. I may not accomplish it, but I’ve had a great time thus far trying.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I plugged my Switch into it's base for this one. You should, too. You'll need a bigger screen to take in all the gorgeous period style animation dripping off this game! I'd seen clips, but actually playing this is a different animal. Perfect balance of fun, and challenge. I'm gonna go Google if there's a sequel in the works...

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Very fun. I only have played a couple of levels but it is a good challenge. The artwork is so cool.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Great game edition, includes the cards and physical game cartridge, beautifully game and this game still have available to collect gold points/coins from Nintendo Store

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 13, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars This is where it's at. Nostalgia at its best baby!
reviews.reviewText: This is so fantastic! How did I miss this? The game is hard, but I remember playing other games recently again... let's just call it Spuper Kario Sworld. It was freakin' hard as heck and this Cuphead game brings back the patience required from when I was a little rascal child and needed a something to keep me out of trouble. Highly recommend for parents who are looking for a multiplayer (local only) game to share with their mini versions of themselves and SUPER old school mixed with amazing new school as well with humor and fun. Enjoy this diamond in the rough.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Beautiful and Brutally Challenging
reviews.reviewText: The old timey hand drawn design is glorious. and the gameplay is as fluid as it is unforgiving. at times, you will be so discouraged that youve gotta put it aside for a rainy day. im a seasoned platformer and i still havnt completed it. so take up the challenge! maybe youre good enough! also the music is great and it came with some rather cute collectible cards. 4 stars

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Cuphead is fire
reviews.reviewText: This games is so fire!! Levels hard so hard but fun, will keep you entertained

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Such a fun gift! Good for all ages!

I have never had a game that kicked my butt so hard … but it’s not frustrating, because you improve with practice and every level feels like an achievement when you beat it. The only game I have had so far that came with some items in the box besides the game (retro style cards which are appreciated)This game is an artistic masterpiece, I’m sure people will talk about this game decades from now.

reviews.reviewerName: Luis Ricardo Garcia Luis Ricardo Garcia
reviews.reviewTitle: Llego en tiempo y forma sin detalles
reviews.reviewText: En cuanto a amazone llego bien el paquete, y em cuanto al juego es una joyita que tenerla en fisico vale totalmente la pena, más que ya trae incluidos los DLC
Excelente, além da DLC, veio com os cards

reviews.reviewTitle: Es difícil de pasar al principio
reviews.reviewText: Buen juego con buena dificultad es difícil de pasar pero una ves que te acostumbras al juego ya se vuelve facil de pasar

reviews.reviewTitle: Um pouco difícil de passar as fases
reviews.reviewText: Meu filho gostou mas demora para passar as fases bem difícil o jogo
